newsitem.title: HUNGARY: MARK DOMINATES LOW-KEY BUDAPEST FX FUTURES MARKET.
newsitem.headline: MARK DOMINATES LOW-KEY BUDAPEST FX FUTURES MARKET.

text.p: Deferred yen maturities made further gains on the Budapest Commodity Exchange forex futures market on Friday but it was the mark which saw the lion's share of turnover, dealers said.
The German unit accounted for almost half of modest turnover of 2.03 billion forints, while the dollar showed a mixed picture of price movements.
December yen rose one forint to 174.80 per 100 yen while heavily traded mark for the same month was little changed at 116.26. The March mark saw a one forint fall to 119.50.
Dollar futures ended mixed, up 0.50 to 183.84 for June, down by the same amount to 189.50 for September and up 0.64 to 195.75 for December.

"The differences are purely a matter of supply and demand and reflect the situation onth by month," said Gabor Herczeg of LaSalle, adding that with low dollar turnover little more could be read into the prices.
The mark also dominated the smaller Budapest Stock Exchange forex futures market with three large trades for March accounting 95 percent of the one million forints' turnover.
